title: Schoko-Bohnen-Brownies
ingredients: 1 can kidney beans or black beans, about 400 g, washed and drained
some oil for greasing the pan
instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 180° C. Line a baking pan (26 x 27 x 5 cm) with parchment paper and grease it lightly with oil.
2. Melt the chocolate in a water bath and set aside.
3. In a food processor, purée kidney beans, peanut butter, applesauce, maple syrup, and vanilla extract for about 3 minutes until smooth. Scrape down the sides with a spatula occasionally.
4. Add cocoa powder, baking powder, salt, and half of the chocolate drops, then blend for another 1 to 2 minutes.
5. Pour the batter into the prepared baking pan, smooth the top, and sprinkle the remaining chocolate drops on top. Bake for about 30 minutes, until the surface is dry and the chocolate drops start to melt. Let cool in the pan and cut into 12 - 16 pieces. Leftover brownies can be frozen.
